1.content:
It was a bright summer day in Ponyville. It's been two weeks since the end of your junior year in high school, and up till now, you haven't done jack. The last eventful thing that happened was when Twilight was coronated as a princess, but that was a week and a half ago. Earlier this morning, you, Spike and Twilight had received a letter from Princess Celestia to catch the 11:00 AM train to Canterlot. It was now 10:55, and you and Twilight are waiting in the cabin for the train to leave.


"Why do you think Aun- I mean Celestia wants us to come to Canterlot so early in the morning?" you ask.


"She must have an important thing for us to do," Twilight presumes. "She did invite the others, after all."


"If that's the case, why would she need me and Spike?" you ask. "We don't have Elements of Harmony like you and the others."


"True, but that doesn't make you two useless," says the alicorn.


"Yes it does!" says a pony coming towards you.


"Good morning to you too, Rainbow Dash," you say with an irritated tone.


"Now is that any way t' talk to somebody?" says another pony wearing a brown cowgirl hat.


"Applejack is right, Rainbow Dash," says a unicorn with an indigo colored mane.


"Oh, I'm sure Dashie was just joking!" says a bubbly, pink coated earth pony.


"Exactly, Pinkie Pie," says the pegasus. "I was only joking."


"Um... everybody..." says a shy pegasus that was just walking in. "I think the train is about to leave."


You look at your watch. "Thanks for the heads up Fluttershy," you say. "We should all sit down."


So for the next forty five minutes, you and your friends ride the train all the way to Canterlot, with you drawing in your sketchbook the whole way there. When you all get to Canterlot Castle, you're greeted by the three princesses, Celestia, Luna and Cadance.


"I hope you all had a pleasant trip," says Celestia. "You must be wondering why I invited you here." You all nod your heads in agreement.


"Well, there are two reasons," she explains. "After months of negotiation, the Canterlot empire has finally settled a treaty with the Changelings."


You and the other ponies drop your jaws in shock. If that wasn't shocking enough, out of nowhere, Chrysalis, the queen of the Changelings, shows up. Fluttershy nearly faints from the stress of it all.


"Celestia speaks the truth," she says. "It was a long debate, but we've decided to let go of our differences."


"We know this is a shock to all of you," says Luna, "but we can assure you that Chrysalis means no harm." Cadance nods her head in agreement.


"Secondly, I heard you all have been having a rather dull summer, so far, so I've invited all of you to stay here at the castle for three weeks!" say Celestia.


You and your friends immediately cheer up, happy to know that you'll be staying at the castle.


"There is one issue though," says Luna. "There are only three available guest bedrooms with two beds each, so someone will be the 'odd one out,' as they say."


"NOT IT!" says the other ponies. You were always so slow when it came to that. Even Fluttershy was quicker than you. So now you have nowhere to sleep. Sometimes you wish you were Spike's size so that a small cushion would suffice for a suitable bed.


"Now, I'm sure you don't want to share a bed with one of the girls..." says Celestia.


She was right. There were several reasons why that would be a bad idea.


1. Twilight hogs the sheets.
2. Rainbow Dash snores.
3. Pinkie Pie would most likely prank you in your sleep.
4. Rarity would want her privacy.
5. Applejack kicks in her sleep.
6. Fluttershy is too timid to have a boy sleep in the same bed as her.


Celestia continues. "...so you'll just have to sleep with one of us," she says, referring to her, the other princesses, and Chrysalis.


"Don't look at me," says the queen. "I prefer to sleep alone."


"I have no problem with it," says Luna.


"I'm sure Shining Armor won't mind you sharing a room with me since he trusts you," says Cadance.


"And you can always share a bed with your dear old aunt," says Celestia. The very second she says that, you knew what was going to follow. As you predicted everyone laughed at you, Rainbow Dash being the loudest. Even Fluttershy was laughing at your expense. Luna and Cadance look at each other, embarrassed for you, while Chrysalis chuckles in amusement.


"Did I say something funny?" asks Celestia, totally oblivious to how embarrassed you are. She may be the royal princess and all, but she can be really dense when it comes to things like this. "Anyway, it's your call."


Who do you choose to bunk with?
1.title: A Royal Invitation

choices: The party crasher and love stealer.
11.content:
You can't believe Celestia just pwned you emotionally and probably mentally. But then again, it was sort of inevitable when discussions were going on.

"(Sigh) Fine, Auntie Celeste," you say, not even caring about the extra laughter you got from Rainbow, or the fact that now even Fluttershy is falling over. You can't wait to see how it goes later on when Twilight starts asking questions to her teacher about your past time.

"Oh, you'll get over this, sweetie."

"You know, this gets me asking about how you even met my parents."

"Like I said before, (your name), it's a long story, a tale oder than you." Could explain why you call her Auntie Celeste until now.

Way before, huh? Oh, yeah; now Twilight really will start asking questions of your life (probably to embarrass and/or blackmail you). Darn sister-figure.

You sigh and just give your Aunt a hug, in front of everyone, and probably making her faithful student jealous.

We've established who you're sleeping with. But who is your actual crush?
11.title: Just get this over with

111.content:
"Okay, Luna and Cadance will lead the rest of you to your rooms, while I take [your name] to mine," says Celestia. The two other princesses lead your friends into the castle, and Celestia does the same with you, but the two of you end up splitting up from the rest of the group. As you both walk to Celestia's room, you take a look at your dear aunt and blush. You've been somewhat infatuated with her for a while. The earliest you remember feeling like this was about six months ago. You don't know what, but there was something about Celestia that caused you to develop a crush on her. Was it the way she carried herself? Was it the way she always had your back? Was it because she was just so damn hot (did you really just think that)? You can't put your finger on it.


"Here we are!" says Celestia, opening the door to your room. You know you've been in your aunt's room before, it's just been so long that you forgot what it looked like. The bed was massive compared to a normal sized one, but you expected that much. There was a door to the right, you assumed that was the door to Celestia's private bathroom.


"Well, make yourself comfortable," she says, "and don't worry about clothes and stuff. I have wardrobes specially picked out for you and your friends."


"You always think of everything," you say.


"Well, your happiness is my top priority," she says, giving you a hug. You really enjoyed Celestia's hugs. It gave you a chance to get a whiff of the sweet scent that permeated from her mane. "One more thing," she says when she releases you. "Since we'll be sharing a bed, you should know that I like to cuddle."


When Celestia says this, you immediately take notice of the throw pillow on her bed. You could see that the middle of it was significantly thinner than the rest of it. You don't know whether to be happy or worried.


"So," says Celestia, "do you still want to know how I met your parents?"
111.title: More Than Mere Attraction

choices: No, Twilight and everyone else butt in. Someone to exchange questions anyway.
Well, somewhat; Twilight is telepathically seeing the conversation.
1111.content:
"Sure," you tell her. You were intrigued by how your parents met Celestia. After all, it always relays in your mind.

"Well, (click, click, click), it was about twenty years ago," Celestia starts, "Now, oh, my, where do I start..? The best part I can remember is that we all met by accident and it was I who encouraged your parent's marriage." Now this really got interesting.

Are you alone?
1111.title: As said, a tale older than you

choices: "You are very precious to me, and I'll do anything to make you happy."
11111.content:
With just you and Celestia in the room, she begins to tell the story of how she met your parents.


"I was supposed to make an appearance at the graduation ceremony for Canterlot University," she explains. "I'm sure your parents told you that they met in college." You nod in response and Celestia continues. "So, I was running a little late because I decided to stop for a slice of cake." You roll your eyes. Your aunt succumbed to her sweet tooth much too often. "Apparently, I wasn't the only one worried, because as I got to the auditorium, where the ceremony was being held, I saw your parents rushing to get inside. Unfortunately, I saw them a little too late, and I ran right into them. After apologizing to me repeatedly, I asked them if they wanted to make their entrance with me. Since they had the highest GPAs out of their graduating class, they were going to be sitting next to me anyway, so I thought that it would be a great idea."


"And then?" you ask.


"I got to get to know them better during the party after the graduation ceremony," she continues. "We all had a lot in common, especially me and your mother. When I asked them if they were dating, they got all embarrassed and said no." You sigh. Another bad habit of Celestia was that she was too forward. "Whenever you get all flustered it reminds my of how your father acted back then. Our friendship grew over the years, and I eventually served as the maid of honor at your mother's wedding." You then remember seeing Celestia in your parents' wedding photos. As expected, she hasn't aged a day since then.


"Before your parents passed, they told me that should anything happen to them, they wanted me to look after you, and I kept my word," she said. "So, that's pretty much everything."


You smile at the story Celestia just told you. The fact that she was so devoted and always kept her word was one of the many reasons why you became attracted to her. Without thinking, you wrap her in a tight hug, and she hugs you back, wrapping her wings around you. "Thanks for telling me that story, Auntie," you say. "I can see why my parent wanted you to take care of me."


"No problem, sweetheart," she says. "And I want you to know one thing..."
11111.title: The Tale Begins

choices: Discord wants to talk to you alone.
You get Celestia alone and ask her why she invited Discord.
111111.content:
You feel your eyes begin to well up when Celestia says this to you. You begin to hope that this is a sign that she’d be open to a relationship with you, but you don’t try to ask her yet. You just enjoy the moment. Maybe someday you’ll gain the courage to admit your feelings. It’s not like there’s anypony that likes her, too. You have all the time in the world.


After you leave the bedroom, you hear Twilight and your other friends chatting in the distance. You follow the sounds of their voices and end up finding them at the castle’s main balcony.


“Hey guys,” you say.


“Hey, [your name],” says Rainbow Dash. “Did you get all settled in with your auntie?” The pegasus starts to chuckle, and you roll your eyes.


“Whatever, Rainbow,” you say. “Anyway, did you guys get settled into your rooms?”


“Yep,” says Twilight. “Applejack’s rooming with Pinkie Pie, Rarity’s rooming with Rainbow Dash, and Fluttershy’s rooming with me. Thankfully, she doesn’t keep her side of the room cluttered like your room back home.”


“It is not that messy,” you say defensively.


“It is for my tastes,” she says.


“That’s because you’re so OCD,” you say.


“He has a point, darling,” says Rarity. “You just don’t understand artists. I can totally relate to you, [your name]. There’s nothing wrong with a little organized chaos.”


“Did somepony say ‘chaos’?” asked a familiar voice.


A puff of smoke suddenly appears out of nowhere, and when it dissipates, you see a draconequus before you. The only draconequus you know goes by the name of-


“Discord!?” everypony says.


“Hello, everypony!” he says. “Princess Celestia invited me over to the castle to stay for three weeks. I assume you all got that same invitation.”


“Oh yes,” says Fluttershy, happy to see her friend. “We’re glad you’re here, Discord.”


“Speak for yourself, Fluttershy,” you think. You really didn’t like Discord. Between you and your friends, that guy always messed with you the most (Twilight was a close second). You never thought he was evil, per se, you just thought that he was a major troll (which, in your opinion, was worse). Hopefully, he won’t fuck up your vacation.


“I’m glad you could make it Discord,” says Celestia, who had just arrived at the balcony.


“Well the only reason why I came is because you invited me personally, Tia, darling,” says Discord, walking up to the princess and kissing her hand. When he does that, part of you gets a little riled up. Hopefully, he wasn’t seriously flirting with your aunt, because the last thing you need is someone getting in between you and her.


What happens now?
111111.title: The C Word

choices: Ask how he knows (inadvertently admitting it)
1111111.content:
"[your name]", Discord begins. "Might I have a word with you, in private."

"Well of course," Celestia blurts before you have a chance to refuse. "I think its about time the two of you finally made up."

You look at your aunt pleadingly, but it's clear this is one of those things she won't relent on. You loved her and all, but sometimes she could be so stubborn when she got these weird ideas. Sighing in defeat, you follow Discord out of earshot of the others.

"Well," you say flatly.

A mischievous grin grows across Discord's face. "Tell me, [your name]. Might you have a little crush on your auntie Tia?"

You feel yourself go pale at his words.
1111111.title: Discord wants to talk to you alone.

choices: In fact, I've come to help
But I have come with a warning.
11111112.content:
"How did you know?!" you asked in a hiss of disbelief.

"Obviously, you just told me," Discord said with a smug grin as you deadpanned. "And love is a fairly chaotic thing, making people fall in love with all sorts of individuals......like you and your dead AunTia," Discord teased.

"If you say anything to her about this....," you threaten, knowing it was futile with him.

"Amusing, but don't worry, I didn't come to expose you're secret," Discord assured with a smirk....
11111112.title: Ask how he knows (inadvertently admitting it)

choices: "I want you to make up with him and be friends already."
"Me and him are currently, how you say, going out..."
1111112.content:
As you heard yesterday, everypony had ideas to go around Canterlot and explore the venues they had in mind. You on the other hoof, decided to wait until they left. Knowing Celestia, she stays on the balcony for a while then resumes her work. You decided to take this chance to talk to her.

"Um, Auntie Celeste?" you say, not knowing where to begin.

"Yes, [your name]?" she replies.

"I know it's not really my business to ask but why did you invite Discord? You know me and him aren't exactly b7ddy buddy like he is with Fluttershy."

Her reaction was one of surprise. "Well, the answer is simple really--"
1111112.title: You are gonna hate this response anyway...

11111122.content:
Celestia becomes nervous and starts to fidget a little. It reminded you of Fluttershy in a way. “Well, you see, [your name],” she says, “Discord and I are… sort of… going out.”


It takes you a few seconds to process this, but you end up yelling your reaction.


“WHAT!?” you yell, causing Celestia to hastily shush you. “You and him!?” you say in a lower volume. “Since when?”


“About a month ago,” your aunt says, avoiding eye contact with you.


“And why didn’t you tell me?” you ask, feeling betrayed.


“Because I knew that you didn’t like Discord, and I wanted to wait until I was ready to tell you,” she explains. “I know that you two aren’t on the best of terms, but he makes me happy, and I want you to try and get along with him. Would you do that? For me?”


You look down and ponder what Celestia just told you. You wanted your aunt to be happy, of course, but not with Discord. “I’m not making any promises,” you say, and you turn around and walk away.


Later that day, you and Twilight were head to the bookstore in Canterlot. Some time browsing the humor section always helps you feel better when you’re feeling down. On the way there, you consider trying to break Discord and Celestia up so you can have her to yourself, but knowing Discord, he’ll always be one step ahead of you.


“You okay, [your name],” asks Twilight. “You seem grumpy.”


“You promise not to tell anypony?” you say, leading her to someplace secluded.


“I swear,” she says.


You take a deep breath and slowly let it out, then you look at Twilight and say “Celestia and Discord are going out,” you say.


“WHA-mmmmph!” Twilight says as you cover her mouth, anticipating her reaction.


“Quiet,” you say. “I don’t like this anymore than you do, but I’m gonna break them up. I can’t do it alone, though. You in?”


What does Twilight say?
11111122.title: You're WHAT!?

choices: "-- it sounds bad, but to do that is too wrong, even for you."
"-- I can't, unless you have another reason to break them up, hmm?"
111111222.content:
"What do you mean that you can't help?" you ask.

"Exactly as I said, we can't..."
111111222.title: By what terms?

choices: She wants to know why you want to know.
1111112222.content:
You expected this response from Twilight, being the nosy mare that she was. You sigh and give her your prepared explanation.


"Celestia's been looking out for me all my life," you say. "She's always been protecting me, guiding me in the right direction. Now it's my turn to guide her in the direction."


"Fair enough," says Twilight. "That's a good enough explanation for me. So what's the plan?"


"Well, the first thing we need to do is find out what plans those two have during this vacation," you explain. "We can work out the rest of the plan from there, depending on what we find out."


"Sounds pretty solid," she says. "Now, how do you plan on finding out what Discord and Celestia will be doing?"


"Did you forget?" you ask. "I'm rooming with her, and she tells me everything. Getting info out of her will be a no-brainer."


"Alright then," she says. "We'll launch the plan tomorrow."


That night, as you are getting ready for bed, you begin to ask your aunt about her plans with her... ugh, boyfriend.


"So, Auntie Celeste," you say. "What do you have planned tomorrow?"


"Oh, um... well..."she says.


"She's hesitating," you think. "She definitely has something planned with Discord. Got her."


"Discord and I... may have something planned," she finally admits. "What will you two be doing?" you ask.


What does your aunt say?
1111112222.title: The Plan

choices: "I love it, Discord! I'll put it on now."
"Thank you, Discord, but this necklace is really important to me."
11111122221.content:
“Well, Discord and I will be going out to lunch tomorrow,” Celestia says. “What do you have planned?”


“I’m just gonna hang out with Twilight,” you say. Technically, you aren’t lying. Spying on Celestia and Discord together can be considered “hanging out,” right.


“You don’t seem to be bothered by the fact that I’m going out with Discord tomorrow,” she says.


“Well, your relationship with him is just something I’ll just have to deal with,” you say, while in your mind, you think “Oh, I’ll deal with it, alright.”


“I’m glad you think that way,” says the princess. “Maybe you and Discord can spend some time together sometime while you’re here and get to know each other.”


You resist the urge to shudder at the thought of spending time with Discord. “Let’s not go too fast, Auntie,” you say.


The next morning, you catch up to Twilight before breakfast so you can tell her what Celestia and Discord will be doing.


“Lunch, huh?” she says. “Well, this will give me a chance to try out a disguise spell that I’ve been working on. Princess Celestia taught it to me after she learned it from Chrysalis.”


“How ironic,” you say. “We’re gonna use a spell that Celestia taught you to spy on her.”


“Well, we’d better get to the dining hall for breakfast. We don’t everypony else to get the good pickings.”


When you get to the dining hall and get your plate ready, you find that the only vacant seat is next to Discord.


“Fuck my life,” you think.


You reluctantly sit next to the draconequus, who turns to you and smiles. “Good morning, [your name],” he says.


“Morning,” you say in a somewhat cold voice.


Later that day, Celestia and Discord finally leave to go on their… date… You and Twilight silently follow them while the young princess casts the disguise spell. Twilight transformed into a normal unicorn with a light blue coat and a short, choppy mane of a darker blue. For some reason, you were transformed into a pony as well, a unicorn, to be exact. You had a coat and mane that matched your skin tone and hair color, respectively.


“Before you ask, I haven’t figured out how to cast a human disguise yet,” she explains.


“Meh, it’s better anyway,” you whisper. “Canterlot has the least amount of human residents, next to Ponyville. The less suspicion we arouse, the better.”


You end up following Celestia and Discord to a small restaurant, and as usual, everypony bows to her. They end up getting a nice table on the outside patio. Luckily, you and
Twilight get a table that’s rather close to them. Twilight then casts a spell that enhances your hearing so that you can both hear whatever Celestia and Discord are saying. You take a good look at the princess and notice the necklace she’s wearing. It was a custom made one encrusted in diamonds, and you were the one that gave it to her. You smile and remember the day you gave it to her.


It was a month ago, Mother’s Day, to be exact, and Celestia decided to pay you a visit while Twilight was out with her mom. This was the third Mother’s Day that’s come by since your parents passed, but you still hadn’t gotten used to not being with your mom on this day.


This year was going to be different, though. You’ve known for a few months that Celestia was coming over, so you decided to get her a very special present as a way of thanking her for being like a second mother to you. You ended up getting a job and working your ass off to get that necklace for her, but it was all worth it in the end. You remember the look of joy that was on Celestia’s face when she saw her gift.


“Oh my goodness, [your name],” she said. “This necklace is beautiful! I promise I’ll wear it whenever I go out.”


As far as you knew she held to that promise. You remember seeing her wearing it at Twilight’s coronation, and that alone was enough to make you smile like an idiot.



“Isn’t that the necklace you gave Princess Celestia for Mother’s Day?” Twilight asks, snapping you out of your flashback.


“Uh, yeah…” you answer. You then see Discord take something out and put it on the table. It was a small rectangular box. “What do you think is in there?” you whisper.


“I don’t know,” Twilight whispers back.


You both find out what is in the box when Discord takes it out. It was another necklace. One that was much more expensive. It was gold with several different kinds of gems
encrusted into it.


“For you, my dear,” he says to Celestia.


Your blood starts to boil. He may not know that the necklace Celestia is wearing is the one that you gave her, but you were still mad.


“This necklace looks much better on you,” he says.


What is Celestia’s response?
11111122221.title: She tells you.

choices: "What is your history of being [your name]'s guardian?"
"Will you marry me?" (I think I went too far with this option...)
111111222212.content:
While Celestia was rather enjoying the fact that Discord has gifted her the necklace, but seeing that she has your necklace, and if he saw that the promise she made was broken would hurt you, she politely declined the necklace.

"Thank you, Discord, but... this necklace is really important to me," you hear her say. You suddenly heard an angelic choir sound, but then you realize its just some ponies singing. Either way, you were glad that she didn't just give the necklace up.

"What do you mean, Celestia?" Discord asks, not offended, but curious.

"Well, [your name] gave me this necklace. I promised him that I would always wear this whenever I went out. I don't think that he will forgive me if I just abandon that especially when it was for Mother's day a few months ago."

Now he gets it. "Ah, I see. Completely understandable, my dear. Although, I do have one question."

This made you uneasy and Twilight more curious with the [precarious to you] situation. Why doesn't he just drop it already?

"What is it, Discord?" your aunt asks.

"I've been meaning to ask you for so long already--"
111111222212.title: Some luck in the least (or so you think)

1111112222121.content:
Celestia chuckles to herself. “It’s quite the story,” she says.


Twilight’s ears perk up. She’s always nagged you to tell her about your history with the princess, but you never told her. Now she has the perfect opportunity to know your story.


“I was close friends with [your name’s] parents,” Celestia explains. “Actually, I was the one that got them together. I was his mom’s maid of honor at their wedding, and I was there when [your name] was born. After his birth, I vowed to his parents that I would take care of him should anything happen to them.” The princess giggles to herself. “There were even times where I took time off from my royal duties to pay a visit and spend some time with [your name]. He lived in Canterlot for a good portion of his life, but then his dad got a new job in Baltimare, and they moved there, and [your name] spent his middle school years there.” She then sighs. “But then… one summer, [your name] and his parents vacationed here in Canterlot. One night, while [your name] was at Twilight’s parents’ house, his mother and father were walking home, and… they were hit by a drunk carriage driver.”


“My word…” says Discord.


Twilight hangs her head, wiping a tear from her eye, remembering that fateful day. She remembered her mother answering the phone, the shocked look on her face, and the expression of horror on yours when she told you the news.


You try not to cry when you hear Celestia tell the story, and you continue to listen.


“[Your name] had nowhere to go, so I had him stay in the castle for the rest of the summer,” she continues. “It really depressed me, watching him sulk around, so I did whatever I could to make him happy and keep the promise I made. After some serious thought, I decided to send him to live in Ponyville to spend his high school years with Twilight. I figured that if he made friends with her friends, it would cure his loneliness and make him feel a lot happier. I called him every day to make sure that he was doing alright. Even though I knew he’d be fine, I couldn’t help but worry.”


“Why is that?” asks Discord.


“Because,” she answers, “he’s like the son I never had. I love him dearly, and I’d never forgive myself if anything bad happened to him.”


You can’t help but smile when you hear Celestia say that. It fuels your drive to win her heart even more.


“I probably bored you half to death with that story, didn’t I?” she asks.


“Oh, quite the contrary,” says Discord. “I have a better understanding of [your name] now that I know your history with him.”


“What do you think he meant by that?” you ask Twilight.


“I don’t know,” she says. “What he said could be interpreted in different ways. He either wants to get to know you better, or he wants some info on you to embarrass you with.”


“I’d go with the latter,” you say.


When the lunch date ends, you tell Twilight that you’ll try to make some more progress with Celestia than fill her in the next day. In actuality, you planned on admitting your feelings to Celestia tonight. For some reason, you felt like tonight was the night. That evening, as you walk to your room after dinner, you run into…
1111112222121.title: Story Time

choices: above, but with regret as well.
11111122221211.content: You nearly bump into Discord, causing you both to balance yourself on your toes. But you realize that he wasn't trying anything, nor was he gonna. You even saw his expression after he stood up; not how it usually is if not...
11111122221211.title: Not like him

111111222212111.content:
"Oh, hi (name). Sorry for almost bumping into you. I guess I wasn't paying attention to where I was going."

"No. I'm the one who apologizes. I wasn't paying attention either."

"Then I guess we both apologize. Say (name)..."

"Yes? What is it?"

"Hummm..."

Was he hesitating and nervous? This wasn't like Discord at all.

"I was wondering if we could talk privately for a while?"

Now that was a coincidence. Because youwanted to talk to him as well.

"Alright. I have no problem with that."

"I understand if you don't want to-!!! Wait, did you said yes?"

"Yes, I did. Actually, I wanted to talk to you as well."

"Oh. I see. Well then, where should we go?"

"Why don't we go to mine and Celestia's room? I don't think we'll be bothered there."

"Alright. Let's go."

You and Discord began walking towards your's and Celestia's bedroom. The while it took to get there was filled by a rather uncomfortable and awkward silence. Strangely enough, Discord didn't tried anything on you. You arrived and you asked Discord to enter. As soon as you both were inside, you locked the door.

"Umm... Why did you locked the door, (name)?"

"To be sure that no one will interrupt us. Now, please go first. What did you wanted to talk about?"

"Well. I wanted to say that I'm so-, sor-, *sigh* I'm sorry, (name)."

"Um... Missy?"

Nightmare looked at the brute. Her face showing no emotion.

"Look, I'm... I'm sorry about what me and my companions did to you. We let our anger control us. And we promise, by the princesses, that were not going to do anything like this again, to anypony."

That surprised Nightmare. The man who harmed her was humbly asking for her forgiveness. You, on the other hoof, were smiling.

"Don't worry. I understand why you did it. And I forgive you. I won't hold any ill feelings against you and your friends."

"Thank you, missy.", he then looked at you. "Um... If I may ask, who are you? To have such strength and speed... I'ts not something anypony can achieve."

"My name is (your name)."

"*GASP!!!* You meat THAT (name)?! Princess Celestia's and Princess Luna's adoptive nephew?! That (name)?!"

"Well, I don't meat to brag but, yes. That's me."

If Nightmare was surprised before, she was even more so now! Not only her savior was a human, but her also was related to her former host and said host sister! Now she knew why his attitude seemed so familiar.

"Oh, my humble apologies, your highness!!!", said the brute, suddenly bowing.

"P-please don't do that. It's kind of embarrassing."

"B-but your royalty!"

"Maybe so but, I don't think I'm better that anypony or anyone. Look, how about you and your friends just go home and we'll forget this ever happened, okay?"

"Yes, sir. Thank you."

He then woke his friends and they all went their ways. You, on the other hoof, had turned to Nightmare Moon.

"Are you alright, miss Moon?"

"*miss?* Y-yes. I'm fine.", she said, trying to ignore the pain from her wounds.

"No. You're clearly are not. We need to treat your injuries before they get worse. Can you walk all the way to the palace?"

"No. I'm afraid I'm not recovered enough for that."

"*sigh* Well then, no choice left."

"What do you mean- whaaaa!!!"

You picked her up in bridal style and began walking towards the castle, which, luckily wasn't far away. All the time ignoring the stares you two got from everyone and everypony. Nightmare Moon was, of course, blushing furiously. After all, she had never being treated like this.

*This is so strange. And yet, I feel so...safe, while being on his arms. What is this feeling? Why am I feeling like this?*
113212.title: Try to rescue her (positive - Friends)

1132121.content:
(guard 1, guard 2 (both are for this chapter only), Nurse Redheart (for this chapter only))

While you were going to the palace, you were receiving many kinds of looks from the other ponies and people. Some looked at you with admiration, some looked at you like you were crazy for helping someone as dangerous as Nightmare Moon and some looked at Nightmare Moon in fear. You simply ignored them. Nightmare Moon, on the other hand, was having trouble was feeling uncomfortable with so many stares. Noticing her worry, you leaned her head against your chest.

"Yes and no."

"Uh?"

"Oh. Well, if you say so... Anyway, the princesses are very concerned for you."

"I see. I'll take Nightmare Moon to the infirmary and then I'll go talk to them. Thanks for your hard work."

"Sir.", both guards saluted at the same time.

You then entered the castle.

"*sigh* I don't really like when ponies salute or bow to me."

"Why? Your royalty, even if your adopted."

"I know. It's just that, it feel embarrassing and uncomfortable. I don't want anyone/pony treating me like I'm some kind of deity. I prefer to think that I''m just like anyone/pony else. Just because one lives in a palace, dosen't mean he/she is a better person or pony. After all, it's one's actions that define who they are."

"Then, if one is defined by his/her actions, aren't I a monster for what I did?"

"Some may think like that but, while there's always time for god things to become bad, the opposite is also true. Meaning that bad things, or, in this case, pony, can become good."

"Celestia taught you very well, you know?"

"Thank you, Moon."

"You're welcome."

By the time you finished chatting, you were on the infirmary. You then, gently, placed Nightmare Moon on an empty bed and called for the nurse. After a couple minutes, a cheerful nurse appeared.

"Hello, I'm nurse, Redheart. And I'll be taking care of you today!"

"Um... Thank you. But..."

"But what, dear?"

"A-aren't you scared of me?"

"Well, normally I would be but, if Mr. (name) brought you here and if he's comfortable around you, then I don't think your a bad pony. Besides, here, in the hospital wing, our job is to heal, not to judge."

"Thank you, miss Redheart. I't nice hearing it from another pony."

"You're welcome. Now, let's get you checked up, shall we? Mr. (name), I'll have to ask that you wait outside."

"What? But, but..."

You then gently placed a hand of Moon's chin and stroked her pretty face with your thumb.

"Shhh. Don't worry." you said in a kind and caring tone. "I'll be right outside the infirmary. And if you need anything, just call. Also, I'm sure miss Redheart will get me once she's done."

"You have my word."

"A-alright.", she said, smiling.

You then exited the infirmary and sat on a bench at the waiting room. Things were quiet for a moment but, as usual, things didn't stay that way for long. Because suddenly, the door opened and in came Twilight and co., the Princesses, including Cadence, and Chrysalis. All of them sported worried faces, except for Chrysalis, who wasn't paying much attention.

114.content:
As you walk with Celestia towards her sleeping chambers, the ridicule you received just moments ago echoes in your head. You feel yourself getting more and more frustrated with Celestia for humiliating you like that. For a moment, you wonder if you're just being petty, but then you remember all the other times Celestia's treated you like a child over the years. If this shit keeps up, you're gonna explode! When you finally get into the bedroom, Celestia tells you where the bathroom is, and where your clothes are, and you pay half-attention to her, which she quickly notices.


"Are you okay, sweetie?" she asks as you wince at that last word. "You seem a little quiet."


"Okay. This is my chance to tell her how you feel about her babying me all the time. All I have to do is calmly explain how uncomfortable it makes me. Screw that! I'n giving her a piece of my mind!"


"No, Celestia," you say. "I'm not okay."


The princess is taken aback by the fact that you addressed her by her name. "Okay, what's wrong?"


"What's wrong is that you embarrassed me in front of everyone less than five minutes ago!" you say, the sudden rise in your volume making Celestia flinch.


She realizes what she did wrong, but she tries to make it seem like it's not that big of a deal. "Well, maybe they're just jealous," she says.


"Oh, yeah. My friends would kill to have a princess doting on them 24/7." The sarcasm in that sentence is as clear as day.


"Why are you acting like this?" Celestia asks, flustered.


"Because I'm tired of you babying me all the time!" you say. "I'm seventeen years old! I'm going to college next year, and I still have you treating me like a toddler! Why do you always do that?"


Knowing that getting mad wouldn't solve anything, Celestia walk closer to you and puts a hand on your shoulder. "Because I'm your aunt, [your name], and I promised your parents that I'd look out for you."


"There's a difference between looking out for me and babying me," you say, pushing her hand away. "And this may be news to you, but you're not my real aunt!"


Those last few words strike Celestia like a freight train. Without taking another look at her, you walk towards the bedroom door. "I need some air," you say without looking back.


You go out to the castle's balcony, and look out into the distance, taking a long sigh. You finally let out all the anger and frustration that was building up inside you, so why to you still feel bad. All of a sudden, you hear somepony talk to you.


"What are you doing out here?" you hear. You turn around and see Queen Chrysalis walking towards you. She looked rather alluring at this time of night, but you push the thought out of your head.


"Nothing," you say. "Just thinking."


"It wouldn't have anything to do with Celestia, would it?" she asks.


"What makes you say that?" you ask.


"I just passed by her bedroom and heard sobbing coming from inside," she says.


Oh great. You made Celestia cry. Sure, you were mad with her, but you didn't mean to make her cry.


"I know Celestia," says Chrysalis, taking your silence as a confirmation. "She's a strong mare, so whatever you did to make her that upset must've been pretty harsh. She and I may have only just started to get along, but I actually feel sorry for her."


This surprises you. Could Chrysalis really have turned over a new leaf? Maybe she's just playing you. You could just ignore her, but maybe talking to her will make you feel better.
114.title: The Falling Out

1141.content:
Maybe she could help you out. After all, it was the only somewhat logic thing to do anyway.

"(Sigh) Look, Chrysalis," you start, "I was embarrassed and angered by Auntie Celeste babying me like that." By now, the queen is near you. "She was always so ignorant of people taunting me about that whole situation. I just wanted to finally let that be heard."

"But you took it too far," she replies.

Now you were on the verge of breaking down. You really didn't want to do that, especially in front of Chrysalis. "I never intended to make her cry. I just wanted to calmly tell her but my anger got the better of me." A tear fell when you blinked.

"Maybe you should talk to Celestia. I understand what you mean, but at least consider yourself lucky you have someone to care for you, even if she isn't your real aunt."

You realized she was right. She grabs your hand and it causes you to hug her, getting her off-guard. Chrysalis hugs you back and even carresses your hair.

"Thanks, Chrysalis. No wonder I have a slight crush on you."

"No problem, (your name). Wait, what?"

"Uh, I gotta go. Sorry."

She looks at you while you leave. She feels somewhat empowered, but doesn't know where it's coming from. Usually it's from someone else, only this time is an exception. Coming from her, maybe?

You reach Celestia's closed room. You hesitate of opening the door, since you still hear sobbing coming out from the other side. You sucked it up and prepared for what was coming.

Opening the door, you realize it's darker than usual and that Celestia is sobbing from the bed. Now you really feel bad. Not only saying that to her, but making her cry as well? You never saw her do so; and now you see it's sadder than what you thought would be.

"Auntie..?" you weakly say. Celeste gasps and looks up, not expecting your return like that.

How does she react?
1141.title: Tell her.

11412.content:
Celestia is surprised to see you return, and an angry look forms on her face. You don't like where this is going, so you slowly walk towards her, ready to take any yelling or scolding she was prepared to dish out. To your surprise, though, she doesn't say a word. Instead, she slowly raises her arm, as if she were reaching out to you.


"Celestia, I just wanted to say-"


Before you get another word in, Celestia fires a magical blast that pushes you back like a powerful telekinetic force, slamming you into the door. You grunt in pain as you slide to the floor, but you're glad you had closed the door behind you. If it was open, you would've been knocked right out into the hallway, and Celestia would have the chance to lock you out of the room. You slowly get back on your feet and continue to walk towards Celestia. The princess fires another blast, knocking you off your feet again. You get back up and keep walking.


"Celestia please, just-"


You're interrupted again by yet another blast. Fortunately, you had anticipated this and braced for the impact, so you were able to stay on your feet. You keep walking, and you are able to dodge the next blast Celestia fires. Luckily, she had exhausted all the power she had into that last blast, and she needed to recharge. By the time she raises her arm to fire another round, you were right in front of her, at point blank range.


The look of anger in Celestia's eyes scares you, and the tears streaming down from them sadden you. The mixture of fear, sorrow, and remorse brings a tear to your eye as you wait for her to fire. Your aunt looks at you, her magically charged hand inches away from your chest. She can knock you out right now, but then she realizes something. She'd be bringing harm to her dearest nephew. She swore to your parents that she'd protect you, and here she is threatening to knock you unconscious. She can't bring herself to do it, not only because she's be going against her promise, but because she'd be hurting the boy that was like the son she never had.


Celestia slowly lowers her arm, the angry look on her face disappearing. You take this opportunity you hug your dear aunt tightly, as if you couldn't let go.


"Celeste, I'm really sorry for what I said earlier," you say. "I was stupid to let my anger get the better of me. I'm glad that you look out for me and do everything you can to make me happy. I don't care if I'm really related to you or not. To me, you are my real aunt."


You feel tears drip onto your shoulders. "Do you really mean that?" you hear Celestia ask.


"Every word," you say.


The princess sniffles "I'm sorry too, [your name]. I should've been aware of your feelings," she says. "I didn't mean to be so overprotective all these years. I'll try to give you your space."


"Thanks, Auntie," you say.


Unbeknownst to the two of you, Chrysalis was watching everything, a small smile forming on her face. That strange feeling suddenly returned. There was a warmth in her chest that she couldn't explain, and it made her feel good. The Queen of the Changelings walks back to her room, embracing this new feeling she was having.


The next morning, you wake up and see that Celestia was gone. Then again, she has to get up early to raise the sun, so that made sense. You walk into the hallway and you're approached by...
11412.title: Retaliation

114122.content:
You were still trying to wake up. You can start somewhat sleepwalking but it doesn't give you sight of your surroundings yet. This only brings the inevitable to bumping into Chrysalis.

As you yell, you grunt as you hit the floor first, having the Queen fall on you. You finally wake up and realize that she's on top of you. Somehow though, she's not awake.

"Chrysalis?" you ask. In response, she just cuddles up to you. She sighs in content that she's next to you and that that feeling comes back. You find this very awkward forcing you to blush hard. Luckily, Celestia isn't here right now. You have no idea what she would do. But pony-wise, Twilight would be repulsed, Rainbow Dash would laugh, Pinkie Pie, meh, probably laugh too, but gossip about it as well), you don't know about Rarity, probably faint, Fluttershy would stay away from you, and Applejack would most likely beat up Chrysalis, with RD's aid.

You especially don't know what would happen if Cadance or Luna saw you. The embarrassment will kill you if that happened.

It really didn't help that she was sighing, as if she was having a good dream, cuddling up to you, nearly hugging you as tight as you have Celestia yesterday. Why isn't she letting you go? Is her subconscious doing this!?

Unfortunately, it all ends in an awkward manner that you can't even begin to register to forget.
114122.title: Chrysalis

1141221.content:
You lie there, trapped under Chrysalis's weight, trying to get her off of you. She's obviously a very heavy sleeper. It was only a matter of time before somepony sees you two like this, and you can't bear to imagine the outcome of that.


"Seriously, Chrysalis," you say. "Get off me!"


Fortunately, this was enough to wake the queen up. She looks around, confused as to how she got into the hallway, and then she looks down at you. A look of emberrassment immediately forms on her face, and you could've sworn you saw her blush.


"This is more serious that I thought..." she says.


"What do you mean?" you ask.


Chrysalis gets off of you and helps you get on your feet. She then walks with you to the castle balcony, where you two were talking last night. "After we had our little chat last night and you... hugged me... you mentioned that you had a slight crush on me." she says.


"Oh, that..." you say, embarrassed.


"After you left, I felt this strange feeling in my chest that I couldn't explain," she says. "It felt so... unfamiliar to me, yet it was very satisfying. I felt it again when I saw you and Celestia make up. This is the first time I've felt something like this without having to take it from somepony else, and I think it started because of you, [your name]. I think... what I'm trying to say is... it that I-"

"I thought you said you weren't going to be so protective of me?" you ask.


"I did, but this is different," says Celestia, her voice becoming a bit stern. "I don't want you around Chrysalis. Do you understand me?"


You don't want to have another falling out with your aunt, so you try to be more calm this time.


"Auntie, please reconsider," you say. "You know I don't make rash decisions, and I really think Chrysalis is becoming nice. If you give her a chance like you did with Discord, I'm sure you'll see. Besides, you promised me you won't hover over me so much. You can't just say one thing and do another."


Celestia remains quiet for a while, but then she finally says...

You still remember how hilarious it was when Rarity confused that boulder for a diamond, lol (even so, she would have competition with Spike if it was); how Applejack lied the whole time, and when Fluttershy dumping buckets of water on you (it was a complete pain). You still hold somewhat of a grudge on your pony friends, but you let that go when everything went back to normal.

"Chrysalis here actually nearly ruined the wedding of Shining Armor and Cadance and we framed Twilight for it. I'm sorry, (your name). You can't see her anymore."

Realizing it was pointless to try and outargue Celestia, albeit you never did before, you let the conversation drop. But something was funny.

Celestia doesn't want you to see Chrysalis but you both are develeping probable crushed on each other. You know it's only been less than a day, but something doesn't feel right.

As you walk downstairs, your thoughts are interrupted by everypony greeting you as you sit down for breakfast. With it being somewhat possible, you sit someplace as far from the princesses as possible. Twilight especially since you know how she can get when she wants answers from you from the weird way you can act.

The same thought goes over your head, 'Why is she doing this?' You can't help but take a glance at Chrysalis, who you know has changed. You were up to the point of where Celestia can be more than overprotective, but until you see the evidence later on, that is on hold.

You finish breakfast and walk back to the balcony and enjoy the sight of Canterlot. Some ponies say it's boring, especially Pinkie Pie, but you actually tend to enjoy these sights. Unfortunately the good moment is cut short when you were met with a princess you really weren't hoping to see until later.

Who was it?
114122111.title: No other choice left

choices: "We'll try it this afternoon, when Celestia takes us out into the city."
1141221112.content:
"Everything okay, [your name]?" asks a familiar voice.


"Hey, Luna," you say.


"You seemed troubled at breakfast earlier. Is everything alright?" she asks.


"Not really," you say.


"Do you want to talk about it?" she asks.


You think about it for a second. Is it a good idea to talk to Luna about how frustrated you are with her sister. She might take it the wrong way. Then again, you know Luna doesn't normally do that. You decide to tell her what's on your mind.


"Well, it's about your sister... and Chrysalis," you answer.


Luna gives you a quizzical look, wondering what could possibly be the issue.


"Last night, I had a falling out with Celestia over her being so overprotective and smothering. After the argument, I came out here to collect myself, and then Chrysalis came along. After telling her what had happened, she suggested that I apologize to Celestia, and I... got a little caught up in the moment and hugged her. I made up with Celestia afterward. Then this morning, I ran into Chrysalis again, and we were talking about last night. She told me that when I hugged her, a strange feeling welled up inside her, and that she felt it again when she saw me and Celestia patching things up. She then wanted to tell me something, and she was a little hesitant to say it, but then Celestia interrupted us and she didn't get a chance to say it."


Luna finally begins to understand Chrysalis's role in this. She then ponders for a second. "If you ask me, I think that Chrysalis wanted to tell you that she likes you."


Your eyes widen, and you look at the princess. "You think so?" you ask, and she nods her head. "You don't seem bothered by it."


"I believe everypony deserves a second chance, [your name]," she explains. "I was given one, Discord was given one, and both situations proved to work out for the better. The same can happen with Chrysalis, if she's given the chance."


You chuckle. "I wish your sister felt the same way," you say. "After she saw me with Chrysalis, she told me that I couldn't be around her anymore. That led to me being so preoccupied during breakfast. I was wondering why she had to be so harsh, especially when she promised not to be like that. Why does she have to be so protective of me?"


"You aren't alone," says Luna. "Imagine what it's like being her younger sister. To this day, she treats me like a foal despite the fact that I'm a grown mare. I can definitely sympathize with you, [your name]. If there's one reprehensible quality about Celestia, it's that she can't admit when she's wrong."


You both laugh at the truth in that fact. After a few moments of silence, Luna speaks up again.


"You know what?" she says. "I'm going to help you."


"Help me?" you ask.


"Yes," she says. "I can tell you're starting to have feelings for Chrysalis, and I think you deserve a chance to tell her how you feel, despite what my sister says. So here's my plan: I've been practicing telepathy spells for awhile, so I can distract Celestia while you go and talk to Chrysalis. If anything goes wrong, I'll let you know immediately."


"That's really nice of you, Luna," you say. "When should we try this out?"
1141221112.title: Kindred Spirits

choices: Your sister-figurein-law of Love (you might be saved...)
Your actual sister-figure, the new princess of Equestria (you're in deep shit.!)
11412211121.content:
"What!?" you nearly yell. "You can't be serious!"

"Do you see my expression, (your name)?" Luna replies. "I know how much you don't want to abide by Celestia's rules, and I am willing to somewhat bend them for you. Either way, this could be fun. especially since I am the one to make this mischief."

She had a smug look on her face that told you, "Just avoid it; it's a bad idea," but you can barely hear that voice because a louder one is saying, "Do this for Chrysalis!"

"Very well." Her horn starts glowing, bright enough to make a shadow and make her eyes glow white, like Twilights when she uses her Element of Harmony. You could've sworn you heard faint whispers that sounded like Luna, but you realize it's her teleathy at work. "Done. Let's go."

You walk through the hallways and see Chrysalis walking alone, with a slightly confused and depressed face. Did Celestia talk to her as well? You see her in her throne, trying to keep calm the guards and such of problems they "have".

"Hurry now. This can only last for so long. Best be on your way," Luna says.

"Thank you, Auntie Luna." Like Celeste, they (somewhat) insisted on you calling that to Luna, since she's her sister. She blushes, thinking it embarrasses her too much. You walk over to Chrysalis, who is somewhat shocked to see you.

"(Your name), what are you doing here?" she asks. "If Celestia finds out you're with me, we're in trouble."

"Don't worry, Chrysalis," you state. "Celeste is a little bus right now." She looks over to see Celestia struggling to keep control. "So, why don't we take advantage of this? I think I knew what you were trying to say earlier, and so, why not?"

You swear you just had tears of happiness on Chrysalis' eyes as she hugged you. You hug back, not finding this awkward anymore. You start to walk away, but you are interrupted by yet another princess. What's with the royalty around here? Little did you know though, they were both told to have you stay away from Chrysalis since she doesn't completely trust her yet.

114122111212.content:
You feel your blood freeze when you see Twilight rounding the hallway corner. You know running is pointless since there aren’t any nearby doorways to go into.


“Crap! It’s Twilight!” you think. “What am I gonna do?”


“Just stay calm,” says Luna, who’s still maintaining the telepathic connection she established with you just moments ago. “Just tell her that you were just passing by Chrysalis, and she won’t suspect a thing.”


“Hey Twilight,” you say casually.


“Good morning, [your name],” says Twilight. “Say, what are you and Chrysalis doing here?” Twilight knew she couldn’t tell you that she and Cadance are serving as Celestia’s extra eyes so she can keep you away from Chrysalis, so she tries to be as subtle as possible.


“Actually, we just bumped into each other,” you say. “I was on my way to Celestia’s room.”


“And I was on my way to mine,” says Chrysalis. Luckily for the both of you, your respective rooms happened to be in the directions you were walking in, and Twilight seems to buy the story.


“Alright then,” she says. “Oh, [your name], don’t forget that Celestia is taking everyone out for lunch this afternoon, and then we'll be strolling around the city. Everypony has to be ready by 12:30.”


“Okay,” you say, and you say goodbye to the two mares and head off to Celestia’s (and temporarily your) bedroom, where Luna was waiting.


“This is going to be harder than I thought,” you say.


“I didn’t foresee this, either,” she says. “Let’s talk in my room.”


When you get to Luna’s bedroom, you both take a seat on her bed and begin to discuss the situation.


“Twilight’s interruption was definitely unexpected, and it was rather suspicious, too,” says Luna. “When you combine that with how badly Celestia wants you to keep you away from Chrysalis, it’s very likely that-”


“Celestia told Twilight that I can’t be with Chrysalis,” you finish.


“Exactly,” says Luna, “and odds are that she told Cadance as well.”


“So it’s the two of us versus the three of them,” you summarize.


“Not really,” she says. “I can tell Chrysalis that I’m helping you, and she can lend some of her abilities to help us out, since she obviously likes you.”


You blush.


"Another thing," she continues. "I think that asking your friends for help would be too risky."


"No argument here," you say. "While it would be nice to get some extra support, my friends don't really have a high opinion of Chrysalis. Plus, they'll most likely tell Celestia that you're helping me disobey her, and then we're both screwed."


You both sigh. This situation just got a whole lot more complicated.


"So the question remains:" you continue. "How are we supposed to keep Celestia, Twilight, AND Cadance busy so I can be with Chrysalis?"


"We can still use the telepathy spell, and I can fill Chrysalis in on our plan, but we'll have to be wise about when and where we execute it," says Luna.


"What do you have in mind?" you ask.

"Good idea," you say. "Everypony will be split up, and that'll be when I make my move."

That night, everypony goes to the city square. "Alright, everypony. We'll meet back here in three hours, got it."


"Got it!" everybody says enthusiastically. Just then, Luna makes her move.


"Sister, I'd like you to accompany me on this stroll," she says.


"I'd love to, Lulu, really, but I-"


"Please, Tia?" the younger princess pleads.


"Sorry, Luna, but I can't," the older princess replies.


Luna looks behind her and sees that you and Chrysalis have already broken off from the pack, out of sight. "Alright then," she says.


Meanwhile, you and Chrysalis are walking through the city together, chuckling at Luna's distraction. "So you really got Luna to help you get around Celestia's stupid rule?" she asks.


"Yep," you answer.


"I'm touched, [your name], really," she says half-jokingly. "To think that you'd be willing to risk facing the wrath of your all-powerful aunt!" You both burst out in laughter. "Now that she's out of our hair, why don't we enjoy this beautiful night Luna made just for us, handsome?"

11412211121222.content:
"Wait, sync our dreams?" you think.


"Yes," says Luna. "Why do you think I wanted to try again when everypony was asleep?"


You chuckle. You were aware that Luna could manipulate people's dreams to this extent, but the thought of her doing so to help you get to Chrysalis never crossed your mind.


"You never cease to amaze me, Luna," you think.


"Well, I'm a mare full of surprises, [your name]," she says. "Now off to dreamland with you."

"Take my hand," she says. "I'll guide you to Chrysalis's dream."


You do as you're told and the princess guides you through the dreamscape, until you reach a door with Chrysalis's name on it.


"Go on," she says. "Once you're done talking to Chrysalis, I'll pull you back into your own subconscious. Take all the time you need."


"Thanks again, Luna," you say. "I couldn't have done this without you."


"No problem," she says. "Now, you don't want to keep Chrysalis waiting."


You nod and go through the door. You end up in what seems to be a desolate desert wasteland, and see a figure in the distance. As you walk towards it, you notice that it's Chrysalis. Your face brightens up and you start to run towards her.


"Chrysalis!" you call out.


The changeling turns to you in surprise. "[Your name?]" she asks. "Is it really you?"

The queen lets go of you and you both look into each other's eyes. You take in the beautiful shade of green that her eyes have. You both slowly lean in towards each other, your lips inching closer and closer to one another's, before finally meeting with a passionate kiss. "Fine. We'll discuss this in the morning," says Celestia. You can tell by her tone that she's planning on giving you a harsh punishment. Celestia disappears in a flash of light, and Chrysalis looks at you.


"You really didn't have to do that," she says.

"I can't believe you would deliberately disobey me like that," she says. "You've never done that to me before."


"I had to," you say. "Even if you're not willing to give Chrysalis a second chance, I am."


"[Your name], can't you see I'm doing this to protect you!?" she says, raising her voice. "Chrysalis is only trying to seduce you, and you're walking right into your hands!"


"Yeah, I could really tell by the way she was crying when I had to leave her," you say sarcastically. "Luna was right. You really can't admit when you're wrong."


"You had better watch your tone with me, young man!" she says. "I'm not gonna let you walk all over me like last time!"

"As for Luna," she says, "I can't even to begin to grasp why she would help you."

You're starting to understand why Celestia's mad with you. It's not that she doesn't trust Chrysalis, it's that she doesn't want you to fall in love with her. Only question is... why?


"Out of all the ponies you could've fallen in love with... it had to be her," she whispers to herself, although you could hear her. "Why not..." you couldn't hear the last word she said after "why not". Who could Celestia be referring to?

1141221112122221.title: Feels Like You're On Death Row

You weren't expecting Luna's presence here, out of all days and time.

"Lemme guess, Auntie Luna," you start, "you were eavesdropping on us the whole night?"

"And here I am thinking that there was no notice of me at the time," she replies. "So, Celestia, you wanted to see me?"

"Yes, dear sister," Celestia responds. "And also the answers to why you were helping (your name) last night when I especially specifically told you to keep those two away by any means! When I said that, I wasn't expecting insubordination and to let you interfere with the Dream Dimension."

Now it was Luna's turn to frown. "Like (your name) said here, sis, I'm tired, tired of you treating me like a foal, as if I was incapable of doing anything; exhausted of the fact that just because you're the eldest of the both of us means that you have to be all over me like (your name)!"

Silence.

The next morning, you wake up with a start. You get up and look around to see that you weren't in your beach house anymore, but rather the library back in Ponyville.


"What the hell?" you say to yourself. "Why am I back home?" After taking a good look around, you see that you're in Twilight's room, only it's decorated differently. There's some of your stuff in here, too, as if you and Twilight are sharing this room


You flinch at the sound of a tired groan coming from right next to you, and you turn to see that Twilight was still asleep next to you. Wherever you are, she somehow came here with you. Maybe she'll know what to do?


"Twilight? Twi, wake up," you say, nudging her gently. She gives an annoyed groan before turning to face you, but when she opens your eyes, she screams in shock, and so do you. You were wearing a stylish white tux, while Twilight was in the most beautiful wedding gown. "We're married!?" she says in surprise. Judging from how you both look in the photo, you both assume that you must have gotten married right after high school.


"We must be dreaming," you say, more to yourself than to Twilight. "Our dreams must be linked somehow."


"Well, what do we do?"


"Nothing. It's a dream, so we're bound to wake up eventually, so we'll just have to ride it out. Besides, I always wondered what it would be like to be married to you."

Who is it?

You both give her death glares.

"Everypony has a mischievous side to them, [your name]?" the changeling replies. "I figured you'd know that, what with Celestia being your guardian."


Damn. She has a point. "Let's just get on the ride," you say.


Twilight was hoping that the line would be long so that there would be a long wait, which there was, but she momentarily forgot about her status as a princess and everypony moved out of the way for her. You can hear her curse under her breath.


"As you can see, Twilight, there are perks to being royalty," Chrysalis says as the three of you walk to the front of the line, where the roller coaster was waiting for you. The queen opts to sit in the front car. At first, Twilight objects, but you tell her that riding in the front car actually is a smoother ride that riding in the back car. Whether or not that's true, you don't know, but it calmed the princess down, which is all that matters.

You couldn't help but notice the queen smirking at you whenever you were on each other's sides. Finally, the ride comes to a stop, and Twilight finally let's go of your hand. It's only then when you feel the pain in that hand.


"Sorry," she says.

Without warning, your Auntie Celeste lunges for the both you and Twilight and almost crushes you in the tightest bear hug she’s ever given, and considering her fondness for hugs, that’s saying something. Trying to free yourself from her suffocating within your aunt’s cleavage, you push away from her with all your might. Thankfully, Twilight seemed to be doing the same. Though she wasn’t doing much better than you. Perhaps this was one of those examples of age before beauty, or something.

“I’m so happy!” Celestia squealed giddily.

Her grip loosened somewhat, but she still held the both of you firmly against her mammaries . You look up to see her smiling face. “Auntie?” You ask after inhaling deeply.

“Yes, [name].” Her smile was continuing to widen. “What is it?”

“You’re kind of crushing us,” you admit.

Celestia’s eyes widen as she releases the both of you. “Oh my. I’m so sorry for that. I… suppose I got a little carried away there for a second. But you can hardly blame me. This is wonderful news.” She cheered.

“Wonderful?” Twilight inquired after regaining her breath. “You think this is wonderful? We thought you’d be furious with us.”

“My dear Twilight,” Celestia retorted aghast. “What ever would give you that impression?”

You and Twilight exchange looks of bewilderment before your marefriend continues. “But, you’ve always been so overprotective of him.”

“Of course I’m overprotective of him,” Celestia laughed. “He’s family. Ask Luna or Cadence some time. I can be a bit overzealous with my affections, but I never once stood in the way of their romantic pursuits unless I had just cause. And I continue to stand by my decision that Sombra would not have been a good match for Luna.”

Things just kept getting weirder.

“But…” Twilight stammered. “I thought you’d take this as me stealing [name] from you.”

The smile melted from Celestia’s face as she stared firmly at the young alicorn. “Twilight, please. I am his aunt. I changed his diapers when he was an infant. I consoled him when he fell off his bike. We exchanged presents on every Christmas and Hearths Warming Eve we could spare. The boy is my nephew and nothing you could ever do will change that.”

You were awestruck by this. Aunt Celeste normally gushed over your like a school filly, but now that you thought of it, she was just a really affectionate relative. She could be a little overbearing at times, but that was just how she showed her love. There was really no reason for you two to be worried at all.

“Unless of course you thought our relationship was something more than that,” Celestia continued. “In which case I may have to forbid you from ever again reading any of Fluttershy’s erotica.”

“No! I swear that wasn’t it!” Twilight said a little too insistently. Was she afraid of the accusation or the threat? Fluttershy was into some pretty saucy stuff, despite her shy demeanor.

“Besides,” Celestia continued. “I wouldn’t dream of getting in the way of destiny.”

“Pardon?” You ask.

1151311121211111112211122222222212122221.content:
“You see, [your name],” Celestia continued. “I was bereaved when I had to banish my sister a thousand years ago. It devastated me to do such a thing, and the hurt only grew worse as time went on. I couldn’t take it anymore. So, I left my royal duties in the hands of my most loyal advisors and set off on a spiritual quest. I won’t bore you with the details of the cliffs I had to climb, the riddles I had to solve, or the dragons I had to fight.”

“That doesn’t sound boring at all,” you offer, only for Twilight to give you a shove.

“Anyway, I eventually came upon an isolated temple in the mountains to the east. The monks listened to my burden and offered their wisdom.” Celestia paused a moment to take a sip of tea, from a glass you were certain wasn’t there a second ago. “They told me that everything has a destiny. They called it the Will of the Universe,” she said reverently. “But whatever name you call it, we are all bound by it.”

“Celestia,” Twilight interrupted hesitantly. “I’ve read every book there is on ancient pony theology, and I’ve never seen anything on this ‘Will of the Universe’ thing.”

Celestia smiled gently. “That’s because the monks I spoke to were dragons.”

“Dragons!?” You and Twilight blurt out at once.

“Of course. Dragons are a race as old as the world itself. They have meditated on the great questions of life since before recorded memory. And in their wisdom, they found the Will of the Universe. Oh dear,” Celestia groaned. “I can never remember the exact words. They did it so much better. Oh well.” The princess sighed. “They said that one of the most obvious examples of destiny is the pony cutie mark. A cutie mark does more than show a pony’s special talent. It is a part of who we are and helps us understand our place in the world. In this way, they said, ponies are actually privileged over other races because we carry our mark of destiny out in the open for all to see, especially ourselves. We can only achieve happiness by embracing who we really are.”

“And this helped you come to terms with what happened to Luna?” You asked.

“It did,” Celestia nodded solemnly. “They helped me understand that while I hold a portion of responsibility for failing to properly address her concerns, but it was Luna who strayed away from her destined path, leading to her fall into rage and sorrow and eventually becoming Nightmare Moon.”

“So what does that have to do with us?” you ask.

“Ever since formal relations were opened between Equestria and Earth, both worlds have benefitted tremendously. The fact that the average life expectancies for both people has gone up by over two decades is testament to that. Human ingenuity for pony magic has been a most profitable trade for everypony. All seemed quite well until I met your parents, [your name].”

“Why?” You ask. “What happened?”

“To put it simply,” Celestia explained. “I got a feeling.”

“A feeling?” Twilight repeated.

“That’s correct. You see, the monks taught me to listen to the Will of the Universe, to feel for its message. When I met you parents, I had this overwhelming feeling that the two of them would make a cute couple. I’m certain you’re tired of hearing the story of how I helped set them up by now. Anyway, I didn’t get any more feelings after that, at least not related to them, but I decided to follow up on it. Your parents and I became close over the years and I can’t tell you how excited I was when you were born, [your name]. When I held you for the first time, I remember thinking that if the only thing that came from that feeling was this precious bundle in my arms, it would have all been worth it.”

You groan in annoyance while Twilight cooed in girlish delight.

“And when your parents died,” Celestia continued. “I got another feeling that the best place for you to stay would be in Ponyville. And I think we all see what that has resulted in,” she indicated you and your marefriend.

“But that doesn’t really make sense,” Twilight strained to understand. “What exactly do all these feelings mean?”

“The feelings are messages from the Will of the Universe. I never know the destination, but they do provide the direction of the journey. You must understand that the monks taught me this lesson a thousand years ago. I have had many feelings sense. One of the more recent was that a blank flank unicorn filly who had managed to hatch and grow a dragon would make a welcome addition to my academy.”

Twilight’s eyes widened in awe. “So, the reason you took me in as your protégé was because of these feelings?”

“Not at all,” Celestia shook her head. “The feeling was only that you should attend my academy. It was your studious nature and natural talent which allowed you to rise above your peers and become my protégé. You did that, Twilight. The feelings merely offered the suggestion that you be allowed to try. And now look at you,” Celestia indicated Twilight’s wings. “Would you have had it any other way?”

Twilight craned her neck to look at her wings, then smiled when her eyes met yours. Finally she returned to face Celestia. “Not at all.”

“And that is the Will of the Universe. It is a guide for us to become what we are meant to be.”

“But what does that have to do with us?” You ask insistently.
